summary: When a college closes, students can be left with loans, no degree, and no path forward. Some students may be eligible for federal student loan forgiveness through a "closed school discharge" from the Department of Education. But, some students still struggle with loans after a closure despite being eligible for relief. We found that outreach to potentially eligible borrowers can be confusing and may not...
title: College Closures: Education Should Improve Outreach to Borrowers about Loan Discharges
